page.title: 16HARLOW'S ROMAN DAY.
page.content: The first{Roman Temple}on the Harlow site was built in A.D.80.In 1985 plans are being made to re-excavate it.To launch the scheme Harlow Museum organised a{Roman day;}600 children, their teachers and parents became Romans or Celts for the day.Children made their own costumes and ceremonial masks. On{6th.June}they arrived at the Temple (in pouring rain.) There were many Roman games and activites to join in with.Potters and basket makers were selling their wares and the children had reproduction Roman coins to spend.Actors played parts of the important characters . The climax of the day was the Temple dedication ceremony.The children learnt chants ,dances and made corn dollies to throw onto the ceremonial bonfire.
